text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Timmana; font-size: 14.7px; white-space: pre; transform-origin: 195.276px 109.539px;
white-space: pre; fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14.7px;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre; transform-box: fill-box; transform-origin: 50% 50%;

svg.text: Return themselves​* integer​* decimal​* string​* block​* filepath​* url​* email

text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre; transform-origin: 342.939px 34.398px;

svg.text: Rye code is a block of Rye values.​Block is also a type of Rye value.

text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre;

svg.text: Accept arguments if any, ​evaluate it's code and return result​or failure.

text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre; transform-origin: 346.94px 34.398px;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre; transform-origin: 346.94px 34.398px;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; font-style: italic; white-space: pre;
text.tspan: But what about special forms like
definitions? - These are also just functions in Rye.

text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre;

svg.text: Bind Rye value to a word,​return the value

text.style: fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; white-space: pre;
fill: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 8px; white-space: pre; transform-box: fill-box; transform-origin: 50% 50%;

svg.text: Always return the bound​value without evaluation​even in case of a function

svg.text: x> inc 41​[Integer: 42}​x> square: fn { x } { x * x }​[Function: 1]​x> square 8​[Integer: 64]

text.tspan: * This is a scheme of Rye1 (RyeOne) dialect, a subset to Rye2 or regular Rye.
Rye2 adds few word types/behaviours on top of this, to enable more flexibility. ​ Rye1 is similar to Rebol language.
